Articles.Content:
Hello,

I have  contract to collect 500 ore from the Mun. Thats all just drill it and leave it there. So I built this...

Spoiler

However for some reason the drill won't transfer into the side mounted tanks. The decoupler is set to crossfeed so I'm stuck.

Here's the craft file;

http://pastebin.com/wKALBTa5

Could someone tell me why this is not working please?

Many thanks in advance

Edited November 18, 2016 by LunchIn10Seconds
This question about how to play the game has been moved to the Gameplay Questions section of the forum from KSP Discussion.
Try having the ore tanks with the drills and after the decupler as the deculper is likely blocking fuel flow and the ore.
Are all of your decouplers set to enable crossfeed?
There is also a setting about "fuel transfer obeys crossfeed rules". This can also block a tank from filling.

Many thanks for the replies. I've fiddled around with this design and still can't get it to work. So I threw it away and built this...

Spoiler

It's fairly close to the design that doesn't work but here I'm using one small holding tank in the stack, rather than radially mounted and then surounded this with radial holding tanks. This works and the pic shows it mining away on Minmus (another simple get this ore contract).

Both designs have a coupler between the drills and the tanks so the only thing I can think of at the moment is that you cannot mount small holding tanks radially. Bit of a pain really.
Hmmm. All right -- I'll try testing your theory out and see if I can duplicate the bug.

On 11/18/2016 at 8:03 AM, LunchIn10Seconds said:

Hello,

I have  contract to collect 500 ore from the Mun. Thats all just drill it and leave it there. So I built this...

  Hide contents

However for some reason the drill won't transfer into the side mounted tanks. The decoupler is set to crossfeed so I'm stuck.

Here's the craft file;

http://pastebin.com/wKALBTa5

Could someone tell me why this is not working please?

Many thanks in advance

What's wrong with your original design is that your ore tanks are disabled in their context menus. Activate the ore tanks, and it works just fine.
